title: Strengthening Service Quality Practical Competencies: Autonomous Vehicle Platoon Control Optimization Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of control engineering, automotive engineering fundamentals, linear algebra, and optimization theory
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can explain the synchronization optimization principles of platoon control systems and apply them to dynamic environmental changes.
Learners can implement the design process of a bi-level optimization algorithm (control layer/performance layer) with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can derive control parameters that meet safety requirements (inter-vehicle distance, speed limits).

At the end of the six-month program, learners analyze three or more simulation datasets reflecting vehicle entry/exit scenarios (e.g., parking lots, toll gates) and write a safety improvement report (3+ pages) based on simulation results.
Learners can evaluate a vehicle cooperative control system utilizing an optimized backstepping control technique.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
